intro: Astragalus oophorus var. wilkenii, commonly known as the "eggplant milkvetch," is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain small, round seeds. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and habitat preferences compared to other Astragalus species.
